menuClasses

Class Menu

  • java.lang.Object
    • menuClasses.Menu
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MainMenu

    public abstract class Menu
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows the creation of a menu with a given number of options to choose from.
    Author:
    carlosgrivera

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Option activate()
      Activates the menu: displays the different options, request a selection from user, validate, and return the option corresponding to the user's selection.

    • Method Detail

      • InitializeMenu

        protected void InitializeMenu(java.lang.String title,
                              java.util.ArrayList<Option> options)
        Initializes the menu.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the menu
        options - the list of options to be displayed by the menu. Each option is displayed numbered 1, 2, .... That number is the number used to determine the user's preference when a menu is displayed.

      • activate

        public Option activate()
        Activates the menu: displays the different options, request a selection from user, validate, and return the option corresponding to the user's selection.

      • addOption

        protected void addOption(Option opt)
        Adds an option to the menu system
        Parameters:
        opt - option to be added

      • displayOptions

        private void displayOptions()
        Displays the options in the menu system

      • getSelectionFromUser

        private int getSelectionFromUser()
        Reads and validates use
        Returns:
        selection number in the menu
